21$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$8/28/2013 1:22:45 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I was on the medication for about 2 weeks when I started experiencing really bad side effects. This has been very scary for me.

55$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$3/17/2010 11:28:40 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I am taking Pristiq 50mg for depression.  The psych decided to give me Geodon to boost Pristiq to help my depression as I am not getting complete relief with Pristiq.
I took Geodon for a total of 4 days.  I was off from work all week because of Geodon.  The first 2 days I took 20mg and felt as if my equilibrium was off & I was off-balance.  Also
column2: for someone who goes to bed by 9:00pm every night
column3: I was up until 1:00am all 4 nights
column4: and even with 6 hrs of sleep
column5: I felt fine the next day.  Everything about what I did and felt was out of character for me.  By the time I hit day 4
column6: I was in the emergency room.  My blood pressure increased to 188/110
column8: and experienced a day-long panic attack.  It's been 2 weeks since I stopped taking Geodon and I still am experiencing chest pain.  My psych had me stop Geodon and now wants me to take Abilify.  He says that after Geodon
column9: the chest pain I feel is a symptom of a manic episode.  Funny... I NEVER experienced a manic episode in my entire LIFE and it wasn't until I took Geodon that I did.

column1: I need to go see a regular MD to make sure there isn't any permanent cardiovascular damage
column2: as I still feel awful.  This drug is dangerous in my opinion.  If your doctor prescribes this for you
column3: be sure you are monitored VERY carefully.  This is not a drug you mess with at all."

column1: 62$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$10/26/2009 4:49:38 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$1$2$I have been diagnosed with major depression and for some reason my doctor had me on this for years. As a result of it I am suffering from Tardive Dyskinesia which I have now had for two years with no cure. If there is another medication that will help you
column2: I would try it and don't stay on Geodon for too long.

column1: 82$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/9/2009 11:22:03 PM$Reviewer: Alexandra
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$5$Suffering from depression (which started from postpartum) for over 17 years
column3: with many
column4: many meds that did not work
column5: one summer about 5 years ago
column6: my therapist (not psychiatrist) suggested adding Geodon to my antidepressant. The therapist was thinking I had shades of being bipolar and this drug was starting to be used as a mood stabilizer. I thought it was a miracle. I felt like my real self again
column8: laughing and was even able to take my young daughter on a week-end trip. (The only time I've been well enough to take her anywhere.) I had no side effects
column10: but it stopped working after 3 months. I was crushed and back in the abyss again. In the last two years I have finally been diagnosed with bipolar I disorder. While it didn't work very long for me
column11: I had one happy summer and I believe it could be very effective for others.

column1: 211$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/25/2013 11:10:59 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$2$I knew better to get on this drug
column2: but I felt my psychiatrist knew what she was doing
column3: I trusted her and agreed. She was hoping it would help my flatness. I felt somewhat better
column4: but my speech became very strange/difficult to understand. My face made movements I didn't try to make
column5: around my mouth. When I went off almost exactly a year ago with my psychiatrists' agreement I lost an entire week. I know only what others have told me - seems I split my time in sleep or the restroom (different issue
column7: realized later what that issue was
column8: and that it was probably confusing me a lot). Not sure if I ate much of anything
column9: but apparently I managed to call in for anything I was supposed to do that week
column10: and that my coworkers thought there was something odd about what I said when I called in on my work shift - I didn't find out what. The first day I could remember I was very confused
column11: and my mother happened to call. I asked why it was so dark out in the afternoon
column12: having trouble realizing it was ~8pm when I thought it was ~3pm. My dad came and picked me up to stay with my parents a few days until I wasn't all confused. They said I could hardly get my mouth to cooperate to eat anything. I was still having a lot of difficulty trying to speak
column13: but that wore away some - I'm better
column15: but still have difficulty speaking and being understood. I have very poor prospects of finding a job like this.

column1: 213$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$8/17/2013 8:08:54 PM$Reviewer: tinnlizzzy
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$2$5$"Easy to use
column3: just pop a pill or 2 into my mouth before bed with pleanty of water hoping not to get heartburn.

column1: Satisfaction? You decide. Weight gain for sure
column2: now at 190lbs being a female
column3: increased dry mouth with starchy (carb) food cravings
column4: absolutely what sex drive I had left has deminished; if I don't catch the sedation effect within 15 mins after taking I am up all night. Have a sense of false well being.  Maybe not the right supplemental drug to Cymbalta for me with reoccuring depression.

column1: I have also spoken with several others taking Geodon who say their experience with Geodon has been tricky for them.       "

column1: 223$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/11/2013 9:23:46 AM$Reviewer: ellensmithee$1$1$1$After staying with the same American
column2: medication-fixated doctor for over a decade
column3: I changed to a European
column4: diet-focused doctor who
column5: upon learning what Rxs my first doctor had me on
column6: immediately took me off them. I had not been on Geodon long
column7: and he said that’s a lucky thing. He said if I’d have stayed on Geodon a decade
column8: I would “be a slobbering zombie”. If that shocks you
column10: as well. Do NOT take this poison. Eat organic because pesticides and GMO foods are making you sick. This is your wake-up call.

column1: 227$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/16/2013 1:48:47 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$3$While inpatient at a psych hospital for severe depression/suicidal ideation
column2: a doctor added a low dose of Geodon (taken in the evening) to the anti-depressants I was already on (Effexor and Wellbutrin). The first couple of nights
column3: I was extremely tired the next morning and unable to get out of  bed the until close to lunch time. By the third day
column4: sleeping was no longer an issue
column5: and I felt a bit jittery. The fourth day
column6: I felt like my heart was beating fast
column8: I had a full blown panic attack - racing heart
column12: muscles clenched - I have never in my life experienced a panic attack
column13: so I can only conclude the Geodon caused it. I quit taking it
column14: and in a couple of days
column15: was feeling calm again. I know everyone reacts to medication differently
column16: and it seems to help some people
column17: but I always thought most side effects were mild - nausea
column20: etc. - I didn't know it could make me feel like I was going to die! It was not an experience I would wish on anyone. This is a very powerful drug and should be taken with extreme caution.

column1: 238$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$1/7/2013 9:56:45 AM$Reviewer: Cholula8
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$This pill is THE DEVIL and unless you have or have had extreme bouts with psychosis and/or Schizophrenia and are institutionalised
column3: I would strongly urge you NEVER to put this pill in your mouth.  After being on 20mg this pill for four days to help with depression and anxiety (I have never been diagnosed with Bipolar
column4: but we were trying to discover if thats what I had)
column5: this pill induced psychosis
column7: and gave me the movement disorders; dyskinesia
column9: and Dystonia. I have had to quit work
column12: and have had to work with a neurologist for the past eight months to undue the damge this pill has done to me--some of which may be permanent. I know everyone experineces medicine differntly
column13: but this pill has not been around long enough and does not have the research to back up it's claims.  If you have had problems tolerating other medications
column14: PLEASE DO NOT take this pill. I may be in the minority when it comes to getting tons of side effects off of every pill
column15: and I may be that one in a million for whom this pill did not work. If you could see what I have had to endure this past year
column17: I think you would agree that this pill is best left for only the most severe cases. Taking this pill has been the only regret I have in life and I want to make sure no one needlessly takes this pill ever again. I wish you happy mental health and good luck if you take this pill

column1: 243$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$12/2/2012 4:48:30 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$was on 20mg. twice a day for 2 months. Developed back pain and had trouble breathing. Was told that it couldn't be the Geodon. Had numerous medical tests that were negative.Finally
column2: got off it to see if it would help. It did BUT I developed TD and continued having trouble breathing. I was told it could take 6 months to a year for the TD to go away. The TD affected my social life by making me very self-conscious.I am a retired 64 year old woman whose friends know nothing about my disease and I want it to stay that way. This drug only did bad things for me. I wish I has never taken it. I am taking BCAA because it is said that it helps decrease TD. That is working for me.

column1: 336$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/24/2011 12:31:05 AM$Reviewer: clfar10
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I was on it for 2 weeks and thought I would never walk normally again.  I have been constantly tingling all over with a feeling of tightness
column3: stiffness in all extremities
column4: but mainly in my L knee cap area
column5: which I previously broke in 3 places 20 years ago.  I have been enormously swollen in ankles and feet
column6: and I am someone who does not swell ever.  I had chills and goosebumps then get hot quickly and start perspiring.  I stopped taking Geodon - 2 milligrams - 3 days ago and the swelling is somewhat better
column7: but my legs and arms continue to ache and tingle and my bum knee is hurting very badly.  I had severe insomnia too.  I agree with another writer - WALK DON'T RUN FROM THIS DRUG.  Sad thing is

column1: 343$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$3/28/2011 3:19:51 PM$Reviewer: $4$4$4$I take a small dose. It is 40mg at night. It takes me about 30-2hrs to fall asleep. I have gone up to the 60mg and it is just way to high a dose. So 40mg is good. I did have facial tick with the 60mg. So watch out. I also do not crave sugar like I did before. So I have actually lost weight. But I work out alot and everyone is different. I can get out of bed and face the world during the most difficult time in my entire life. So thats what I have to say.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I began taking geodon and almost right away I felt awesome! Shortly after that there was a tragic death in the family but this drug kept me feeling happy and positive. After a while the effects started to diminish so the doctor would keep raising the dosage. With that I noticed that the side effects effected my sleep if I did not take it early enough in the evening. This brings up the only problem I have with this drug; if you miss a dose you’re going to notice. If I forget to take it I will not be able to fall asleep at all
column3: and if I still haven’t taken it after 12 hours of when I usually do I will get really sick.

column1: 486$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$12/12/2009 10:37:46 PM$Reviewer: Catherine
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$3$I was put on this while in the hospital and by the second day of being on it I could barely urinate. The nurses had to start doing bladder scans before and after I went to the bathroom
column3: well at least tried anyways. I was a few cc's of fluid short of having to be catheterized thankfully. By the third day the doctor thankfully took me off of it. Yeah it was only three days
column4: but these three days seemed like forever with the pain of the pressure I was having from not being able to urinate.

column1: 514$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/30/2009 6:17:16 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $5$3$2$"My 18 year old daughter was prescribed Geodon 20mg twice a day to go along with her Lexapro 20mg. After a month of not feeling better
column2: her psych increased the dose to 40mg twice a day. After a few weeks
column3: she is sleeping all day if she takes the morning dose and can' sleep at night if she forgets to take the evening dose. If she doesn't take it all day
column4: she experiences ""withdrawal"" like symptoms. Headache
column5: anxiety thru the roof
column9: feels like her muscles are 'clenchy' and twitch
column11: gets red splotches on her face and feels as though she cannot relax. Because it was gradual for her
column12: we didn't realize that the symptoms could be from the Geodon. But the more I read
column13: the more I think that they are from the drug. She has a med/eval with her psych tomorrow and I hope to get her off of this. Even though she feels like it's the best MENTALLY so far that we've tried with her Lexapro
column14: the side effects are incompacitating her and she cannot function on a daily basis. This simply is unacceptable and I will try to find her something else."

column1: 522$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$8/26/2009 2:22:52 PM$Reviewer: Suzanne
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$3$My 20 year old son was taking this medication for 2 weeks to help him with his mood swings and depression. After 2 weeks of taking Geodon he started hearing voices telling him to kill family members
column3: and was seeing bloody images on the walls. He came to me to let me know something was very wrong as he was hearing the voices. He had been becoming very upset and hostile after the first week
column4: and not able to sleep. He ended up hurting his brother and having a panic attack. The doctors at the ER said to not let him take it anymore. His med doctor called the next day and asked us to increase it double which I refused. I would NOT reccamend Geodone to anyone unless they are under complete supervision and care of a professional for that first 1 month time frame. This is a very scary drug.

column1: 527$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$8/9/2009 10:54:03 PM$Reviewer: Nermal
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$3$"I've only been on Geodon for a week. First couple of days didn't feel any benefit
column3: but on the third I had nearly complete relief. (Major depressive disorder/anxiety)

column1: I can't remember feeling this 'normal' since I was in college back when the earth was still flat.
I'm praying that it continues to help
column2: and that it helps you all too."

column1: 529$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/29/2009 12:47:41 PM$Reviewer: $1$1$3$this drug causes tardive dyskonesia.  do not take it!  you will have tics and tremors that never seem to go away.  cannot be controlled by other meds.  very dangerous drug!

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$5$I can go to sleep easy now
column3: but stay asleep for 8 to 10 hours.  It has helped a little with the depression
column4: but not much.

column1: 573$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/29/2009 3:08:30 PM$Reviewer: mike
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$3$The drug caised me to go into A fibrillation.

column1: 576$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/23/2009 4:01:40 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$4$"My husband was on this medication for a few weeks. He is also on Celexa and this was added to his treatment program. They started him out on the 20 mg/day program. He was doing OK at that level. Almost immediately after they increased him to 40 mg/day he arrived in hell! He was constantly nauseous and vomiting. He constantly complained about feeling dizzy and ""just not himself"". He met w/ his psych today and told her he's not messing around with any more meds other than his Celexa. His sugar levels are all screwed up and he is nervous and shaky and can't even relax to sleep at night. I can't wait until this is out of his system. I'd rather deal with him being on-edge than have him throwing up all day!"
578$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/17/2009 2:38:13 PM$Reviewer: tampamommy
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I have been on this for a week and can't eat
column3: am sick to my stomach all the time
column4: have diahrea and feel like I want to jump out of my skin.  I feel shaky and taking extra sedatives just to get through the day.  I am asking my doctor to take me off it.  The side effects are not worth waiting out.

column1: 584$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$3/30/2009 5:57:21 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$2$1$I was prescribed this (either 40 or 80 mg a day) to help me sleep
column2: along with Celexa. Well
column3: it helped me sleep. A lot. If I didn't get at least nine hours of sleep a night
column4: I was drowsy (almost unsafe-to-drive drowsy) for the whole next day. If I missed a dose
column5: I couldn't sleep at all until I took it again. I had to stop taking it when my insurance ran out and I couldn't sleep for several days. Definitely not worth the price to me.

column1: 589$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$3/18/2009 5:33:12 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$Makes me very very sleepy. Take at bedtime cut back on sleeping pills.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$2$2$when taken at night i have promblems sleeping. i get these pains in my brain. they feel like pinches and i automatically move my head back and forth to relieve the pain. i don't know why it happens. it doesn't happen that much
column3: but enough to know how uncomfortable it feels.  does anyone know what this could be or mean?

column1: 597$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$2/19/2009 8:41:58 PM$Reviewer: [email protected]
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$3$"I have been taking Lexapro for the last 8 months for major depression
column3: with no effect
column4: so my Dr. added Geodon twice a day which was supposed to increase the effects of the Lexapro. From the very first day I took it I felt dopey and giggly and strange- it scared me because I felt sort of ""out of it"" but the worst part was my legs at night- felt like restless leg syndrome that I've seen on tv!!  I've never had this before and it was horrible! I was kicking in my bed all night.  Also
column5: I was becoming increasingly nervous because I couldn't stand the TOO HAPPY and dopey feeling.  I have 3 kids to manage and I have to be able to function.  I stopped taking this drug after only three days but I still felt the strange effects in my system for two more days.  I wish I could just find a regular anti-depressant that works.  No more anti-psychotics for me! "

column1: 598$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$2/13/2009 7:09:19 PM$Reviewer: dixiedee

column4: feeling faint
column5: being tired all the time but unable to sleep
column6: feeling like jumping out of my skin
column7: puffy face and involuntary quivering and my doseage was only 40 MG.Good luck to anyone taking this stuff.

column3: I have TONS of energy
column4: I pay NO attention to negative thoughts.  All of this is great but
column5: as a nurse

column1: 754$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$12/11/2007 3:33:40 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$5$I take Geodon (40mg daily) for anxiety and concentration (I have major depression). I find that my mood is very uplifted

column3: but only if there are no distractions. If I can't focus completely on one thing
column4: my eyes feel like they're going crazy and my mind won't let met think straight. My anxiety level I haven't felt change.
